document.heading: Corrupt Election Practices Amendment Act of 2010

history.narrative: Law 18-330, the “Corrupt Election Practices Amendment Act of 2010”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 18-894, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations and the Environment. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 23, 2010, and December 7, 2010, respectively. Enacted without signature of the Mayor on January 8, 2011, it was assigned Act No. 18-652 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 18-330 became effective on March 31, 2011.
